# item(forIdentifier:)

**Instance Method**

Returns the Touch Bar item that corresponds to a given identifier.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func item(forIdentifier identifier: NSTouchBarItem.Identifier) -> NSTouchBarItem?
```

## Return Value

A Touch Bar item if one exists for the given identifier; otherwise, returns `nil`.

## Discussion

The system returns items (instances of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouchBarItem] class) as it finds them, according to the following search order, listed here from first-searched to last-searched:

1. Items in the bar’s private array, which are reflected in the value of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouchBar/itemIdentifiers] array.
2. Items in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouchBar/templateItems] array.
3. Items returned from the bar delegate’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouchBarDelegate/touchBar(_:makeItemForIdentifier:)] method.

Your app never needs to instantiate spacing or proxy items because these are created by the system directly, according to their identifiers, as shown in the table below.



For more on the proxy placeholder, see [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouchBar#Composition-and-nesting].

## Observing bar status

- **isVisible**: A Boolean value that Indicates whether the Touch Bar is eligible for display.
- **itemIdentifiers**: The list of identifiers for the current items in the Touch Bar.

items.description: A Boolean value that Indicates whether the Touch Bar is eligible for display.
items.name: isVisible

items.description: The list of identifiers for the current items in the Touch Bar.
